ThingDef.label: sleep stone
ThingDef.description: Sleep stone. Better than on the floor. Like slab bed.

ThingDef.label: sleeping stone double
ThingDef.description: Sleep stone. For two person. Better than on the floor. Like Slab Bed.

ThingDef.label: sleep stone with leather
ThingDef.description: Comparable with a standard bed. Can be considered as a slab bed.

ThingDef.label: double sleep stone with leather
ThingDef.description: Sleep stone with leather. For two person. Comparable with a standard bed. Can be considered as a slab bed.

ThingDef.label: sleep stone with fur
ThingDef.description: Sleep stone with fur. Incredibly comfortable.

ThingDef.label: double sleep stone with fur
ThingDef.description: Sleep stone with fur. For two person. Incredibly comfortable.

ThingDef.label: chief's sleep stone
ThingDef.description: A sleeping stone worthy of a leader. Extremely comfortable.

ThingDef.label: rock for sit
ThingDef.description: The stone for sit. Convenient when compared with the floor.

ThingDef.label: neandertal comfy stool
ThingDef.description: A comfortable and attractive chair. Can be used at tables, work stations, and elsewhere.

ThingDef.label: neandertal couch
ThingDef.description: A large, soft, comfy seat.

ThingDef.Name: TableBaseNeandertal
ThingDef.description: People eat off tables when chairs are placed facing them.

ThingDef.label: night light
ThingDef.description: Place by the bed. Can be used as a torch.

ThingDef.label: stone nightstand
ThingDef.description: Bedside table with a small light. For those who can't afford a night light.

ThingDef.label: heart of tribe
ThingDef.description: Big bonfire. Lots of light. Lots of warmth.

ThingDef.label: rugged column
ThingDef.description: A column capable of holding a roof. Does not block sight or movement and looks quite nice.

ThingDef.label: chief's throne
ThingDef.description: A massive chair, designed for a dignity-focused psycaster to sit and meditate. Reigning on a throne is a form of meditation that builds up psyfocus. For dignity psycasters, more impressive meditation thrones and thronerooms increase the rate of psyfocus gain.

li.noAssignablePawnsDesc: Throne ownership requires a person with a royal title.

ThingDef.Name: NeolithicBrazier
ThingDef.label: flat brazier
ThingDef.description: Flat brazier. For the chief's room.

ThingDef.label: neandertal ornamentation
ThingDef.description: Rock painting applied to a leather canvas. For the chief's room.

ThingDef.label: ice floe
ThingDef.description: Ice floe. Covered with straw. Ice was used until the 20th century to preserve food.

ThingDef.label: stone blackboard
ThingDef.description: Blackboard. As we understand, the Neanderthals did not have schools. Therefore, this object is nothing more than an imitation.

li.reportText: When near a desk where a lesson is taking place, this building increases the student's learning rate. This effect can stack up to three times.

ThingDef.label: neandertal school desk
ThingDef.description: School desk. As we understand, the Neanderthals did not have schools, but at this table you can teach children if there is a normal board.

li.reportText: A multiplier on how quickly children learn during lessons which are assisted by this.

ThingDef.label: stone barrow
ThingDef.description: Tumulus. Stones are stacked in the form of a hill over the body of the deceased.

ThingDef.label: rotten wood door
ThingDef.description: Divides rooms.

ThingDef.label: megalithic door
ThingDef.description: Divides rooms. Extremely heavy.

ThingDef.label: cooking stone
ThingDef.description: The fire is kindled under a large flat stone. Usually bread cakes are baked on such stones.

ThingDef.label: butcher log
ThingDef.description: Log for cutting carcasses.

ThingDef.label: tribal hammock crib
ThingDef.description: Baby bed, in the form of a hammock. But, to be more precise, it is more like a bag.

ThingDef.label: pile of sharp stones
ThingDef.description: Small storage of working tools, prehistoric period. Increases work speed when placed near a workbench.

ThingDef.label: neandertal brewery spot
ThingDef.description: A work to mix wort for beer production.

ThingDef.label: small simple reliquary
ThingDef.description: A ceremonial building that protects and displays a relic. Relics are ancient objects venerated by some cultures, belief systems, or religions.

ThingDef.label: sturdy simple reliquary
ThingDef.description: A ceremonial building that protects and displays a relic. Relics are ancient objects venerated by some cultures, belief systems, or religions.

ThingDef.label: neandertal styling station
ThingDef.description: People can use this to change their look.

ThingDef.label: wood for impalement
ThingDef.description: Wooden stake for holding and displaying corpses. This horrifying sight inspires horror and disgust to onlookers. This is a particularly brutal and effective way to terrorize slaves. Morbid and Spikecore.

ThingDef.Name: N_ShelfStoneForRock
ThingDef.label: rock for stones
ThingDef.description: Storage. For stones, and much more. You can lay down your clubs or fill up with animal carcasses, but it does not save from the weather.

ThingDef.Name: NeolithicBrazierDarkLight
ThingDef.label: flat brazier dark light
ThingDef.description: Flat brazier. For the chief's room. By keeping the fire low, the smoldering coals provide dark light.
